reason: The text describes witnessing a fight and feeling shaken up. While concerning, it doesn't indicate immediate danger to the poster or others. It expresses unease and anxiety but lacks specific threats or plans.

title: User Story: Violence
content: Just saw a couple arguing on the street, escalated fast. Makes you realize how quickly things can turn. Anyone else feel on edge lately? Stay safe out there.
reason: The text describes witnessing an argument, implying potential for violence. However, it is observational and does not indicate imminent danger or personal involvement by the poster.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: Saw a guy OD downtown today. Scary stuff. Narcan worked, thankfully. Makes you realize how fragile life is & how important it is to check on each other.
reason: Witnessing an overdose, even with successful intervention, can be psychologically distressing and highlights the potential for fatal outcomes. While the individual survived, the event represents a significant health risk and potential for harm.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: My friend almost didn't make it last night. Scariest thing I've ever been through. Please, if you're using, have someone with you, and Narcan. It saves lives.
reason: The text strongly suggests a recent overdose event that nearly resulted in death, indicated by the phrase "almost didn't make it last night" and the urgency in advocating for Narcan use. The "scariest thing I've ever been through" statement implies a significant, life-threatening situation.

title: User Story: Suicide
content: Feeling so incredibly low lately. Everything feels heavy. Reaching out because I don't know what else to do. Any advice on finding help?
reason: The individual expresses feeling incredibly low and overwhelmed, indicating potential depression or mental health crisis. They are reaching out for help, suggesting they recognize the need for intervention but may be struggling to cope. While not explicitly suicidal, the depth of their distress warrants attention.

title: User Story: Self-Harm
content: "Things got really bad last night. I'm feeling so ashamed, but I reached out to the crisis line. Talking helped, even a little. It's a long road, but I'm still here."

However, the fact that they contacted a crisis line and express hope ("I'm still here") indicates a mitigating factor and active help-seeking.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: Just saw the news about another OD in my town. Scared. It's too close to home. Does anyone know of resources for friends/family dealing with addiction? I need help understanding this.
reason: While the individual is not explicitly stating intent to overdose themselves, the proximity of an overdose event and expressed fear suggest heightened vulnerability and a potential need for intervention to prevent escalation. The user is actively seeking resources related to addiction, indicating a concern that could develop into a higher risk situation.

title: User Story: Overdose

title: User Story: Overdose

title: User Story: Abuse
content: It's getting harder to pretend everything's okay. The yelling is constant, and now... I don't even know what I did wrong. Is this normal? Feeling so lost.
